Luiz Carlos Wrobel

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/6338514580120246
  • Última atualização do currículo em 17/07/2019

Possui graduação em Engenharia Civil pela Universidade Federal Fluminense (1974), mestrado em Engenharia Civil (Estruturas) pela COPPE/Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (1977) e doutorado em Engenharia Civil pela University of Southampton, Inglaterra (1981). Foi Professor Titular do Departamento de Engenharia Mecânica da Brunel University London de 1996 até 2018, e Diretor do Instituto de Materiais e Manufatura de Brunel de 2014 até 2018. Atualmente, é Professor do Departamento de Engenharia Civil e Ambiental da Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio de Janeiro (PUC-Rio) desde março de 2019. Tem experiência na área de métodos computacionais em engenharia, com ênfase nos métodos dos elementos de contorno e dos elementos finitos, aplicados a problemas de integridade estrutural, energia, transferência de calor, mecânica dos fluidos, acústica, corrosão e engenharia biomédica. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

IMproving Power bAttery Cooling Technologies (IMPACT)
Descrição: This project is an extension on the previous Innovate UK project 102330, which demonstrated the viability of the flat heat mat as a highly efficient thermal transfer device. This application makes use of the knowledge gained during the previous project and uses this to address problems in the automotive energy sector..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

2018 - Atual
Prefabrication, Recyclability and Modularity for Cost Reductions in Smart BIPV Systems (PVadapt)
Descrição: The building integrated photovoltaics sector can benefit from innovations in construction and solar energy alike, even more so when the two are in sync. In the PVadapt project, combined innovations in modular construction and modular photovoltaics will lead to the creation of an adaptable and multifunctional BIPV system of substantially lower cost than conventional solutions. A flexible and low cost production of photovoltaics in automated processes will be employed to produce PV modules as well as elements with integrated heat pipe based heat recovery. These active energy components will be combined with passive and sustainable components with structural, mechanical, thermal and other functions to produce prefabricated BIPV modules. Prefabrication will be the key to achieving cost reductions, as well as guaranteeing quick installation with low disruption. The project will also employ a sustainable by design philosophy with all the parts of the system being recyclable/ reusable and waste based raw material supply chains will be established. A Smart Envelope System featuring grid connectivity, load prediction and shifting and intelligent energy management systems with predictive algorithms will be integrated in the PVadapt turn key BIPV system. To convincingly demonstrate the PVadapt solutions, 7 buildings of various typologies (residential, commercial, 2 offices, and 3 service stations in Spain, Greece and Austria) will have the technology installed and one new 288m2 floor space construction will be built in Portugal with a total of 464kW installed. The LCOE values will be below 2ct/kWh and the cost of the BIPV module will be below 200 euros per m2 and payback below 10 years. In these sites, the PVadapt technologies will be installed in flat and pitched roofs, as wall replacements and facades and shaders, demonstrating the holistic approach to BIPVs, improving their entire life cycle..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (3) .

Integrantes: Luiz Carlos Wrobel - Integrante / H. Jouhara - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Uniao Europeia, Programa Horizon 2020 - Auxílio financeiro.
